Articles.Content: help help plz now i can't send probes with out the stupid mobile processing unit plz help i lkke sending probes
just send moar probes
I don't understand. Nothing about probes has changed. You can still launch them and fly them all around without the mobile lab.

We need more information here - from the gist of the message, I'm assuming you've been sending out probes with Goo Containers and/or Science Jr units and transmitting the data back to Kerbin repeatedly, which you can't do in 0.23 anymore because the experiments now require harvesting and resetting by Kerbals unless you recover them. Is that correct? Assuming that is the case, I'm sorry to say that you're out of luck; its "nearby Kerballed space station" time. The other sci instruments should still work normally, though.
no it says on every experiment that the it will give me only 0% of it back plz help
do you have an antenna?
Or are you in sandbox mode?

Or are you in sandbox mode?

*ding ding ding*
im on career my probe has a communotron 16 on it. is tht y??

Hmm...okay, still need more information - a) is this a fresh install, do you have solar panels and/or batteries installed along with the antenna?

You need an antenna to transmit and the Communotron 16 will do the trick (it's just got the slowest transmission rate of the three antennas).

At this point a screenshot or two would not go amiss. One that shows us the general design of the probes you're talking about, and one that shows what happens when you attempt an experiment.
i have everything you told me but it still not shown science
i have everything

Hayhaa: make another probe with science bits, antenna, battery, solar panel in Career mode; make sure that load up scene has version 0.23.

Science bits only work ONCE in version 0.23

Default/ sandbox has NO science.

Launch and report back.

Edited December 19, 2013 by Lohan2008

no it says on every experiment that the it will give me only 0% of it back plz help
im on career my probe has a communotron 16 on it. is tht y??

Ah, I think I understand now.

In 0.23, an experiment can only be transmitted 1 time in a single location per ship per mission. So if you run an experiment, transmit it, then try to run the same experiment again in that same location, it will show that it's worth zero points.
does that mean i have to be more up or down

It might also help to actually take the time to communicate more than the most basic information possible.

Are you trying to play the game on a phone or what?

These truncated and simplistic "words" are annoying, and making us all guess at what you're really needing help with is annoying as heck. Just tell us what's going on for Pete's sake! What exactly isn't happening to match with your expectations?

Use your words. We're not cavemen here, and we're willing to help if you'll set aside more than 15 seconds to create a response.
My guess is that English is not the primary language Hayhaa speaks let alone writes.
Once you do an experiment, you will get nothing back from one transmission in that biome. You will need to do a return to get the science
ok then how do i do the seismic scan?? it says i can't
Are you on a surface? It doesn't work in space
ok does it also work in the atmosphere?
No. Accelerometers only work when landed on a solid surface. Which is technically still a location in the atmosphere, but let's not descend into semantics.

We're not cavemen here
True, but please keep in mind that we're not all native English-speakers here, either. But yes, Hayhaa, a more detailed description of the issue you're having would be helpful.

We're not cavemen here

At the risk of sounding like an old GEICO commercial.... I am . My proof:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

True, but please keep in mind that we're not all native English-speakers here, either. But yes, Hayhaa, a more detailed description of the issue you're having would be helpful.

Oh absolutely, but the difference between translation issues and cellphone shorthand is huge. I really do like helping folks out, which is a big part of my day job role too, but I think it may be because of that job that I have little patience remaining for people who just cry for help and force everyone who answers their call to waste a bunch of time trying to figure out what they're needing help with in the first place, instead of just speaking plainly about what's wrong.

At the risk of sounding like an old GEICO commercial.... I am . My proof:

http://imgur.com/a/Z6Jqr

Okay, I stand corrected. Most of us aren't cavemen, but at least the ones that are seem to be doing it right.
